bug.author: srbhchandra
bug.summary: step counting for slider not starting at min_value
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
For st.slider, the step always starts counting at 0 and not at min_value. <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
st.slider(label='gaussian kernel', min_value=1, value=1, step=2) starts at 1 (as expected), but the next value after sliding should be 3 <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
st.slider(label='gaussian kernel', min_value=1, value=1, step=2) starts at 1 (as expected), but the next value after sliding is 2 and not 3. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.48.1 Python version: Python 3.6.5 Using PipEnv OS version: Ubuntu 16.04 Browser version: Chrome 77.0.3865.90

comments.comment: I think this is not a problem of streamlit but from baseui/slider, i checked in <denchmark-link:https://baseweb.design/components/slider/>https://baseweb.design/components/slider/</denchmark-link> and it behaves like your test. It seems this is on purpouse so it always step over 0.
Seems to be fixed in the latest version of baseweb

Fixed by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/1319>#1319</denchmark-link> . Will be available with the next release, 0.58.1 Alternatively, it's available now in <denchmark-link:https://pypi.org/project/streamlit-nightly>nightly</denchmark-link>
